title: Introduction to Social Data Analysis Based on Program Code Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer operation skills and elementary-level knowledge of social studies
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education conducted in a smartphone-based constrained technological environment, simulating social domain data as simple code to intuitively understand the analysis process

learning_goals: Learners can explain the code execution process step-by-step through four visual frames (text/graph/table/animation).
Learners can predict social data change patterns using simulation speed adjustment and code modification features.
Learners can analyze code related to three or more social phenomena within a week and interpret simulation results.

resources: Social Data Sample Sets (Demographics/Economic Indicators, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
